column4: Hi I work on an office computer (running Ubuntu) which is always on. When I come and login in the mornings I would like to have my emails automatically downloaded into /var/mail/[username] so that I can check it with mutt. How can I do that? thanks in advance.
Thats not an easy topic. First you have to find out what method your company uses for mailing
what bout gmail?
Does your company uses Gmail for internal mailing? :)
I see :) Well, what does your place use for mails? POP? IMAP?
I would like to fetch Gmail via IMAP.
do I need fetchmail to do that?
Not used mutt long time... hmm, let me trace this on google

when sshing into my campus's linux server it tells me 'You have no new mail' and when i type 'mail' if i have it, then it shows me my mail, i can even mail using 'mail [username]' do you know what program that is?
nvm its built in ubuntu too 'mail' :) ill rtfm :)
Yeah... btw: http://www.andrews-corner.org/mutt.html
thanks Ill give it a read. :D
Maybe that will give you some advice
Still googling tough
there ya go: http://shreevatsa.wordpress.com/2007/07/31/using-gmail-with-mutt-the-minimal-way/
that link was for configuring using POP, but I wanted to use IMAP. I will google it anyways. Thank you for your help.
Not really... http://shreevatsa.wordpress.com/2007/07/31/using-gmail-with-mutt-the-minimal-way/
Did you check this too?
no i hadnt. checking it now. ty
Any time...
Ehm, what about this site? http://www.suckless.org/wmii/guide.html
you > google :) ty
Any time :)
